result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas S Rios was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, assessments and surcharges by 04-05-16 or a civil judgment is to be entered. Cash bail applied.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges pursuant to Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Defendant to report by NOON on 10-08-15

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas S Rios

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Douglas S Rios in court with attorney Benjamin James Harris.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim Impact statement filed with the court.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.  Defendant to report by NOON on October 8.
The court orders the defendant to pay all costs, assessmens and surcharges by 4-5-2016 or a civil judgment is to be entered.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.

Defendant Douglas S Rios in court with attorney Benjamin James Harris.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to count 2:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Count 1 is ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing and the state also will read in an uncharged incident of 4-23-2015.
Victim impact statement has been filed with the court.  Defense is requesting an adjournment of sentencing.  The defendant is admonished that the no contact order remains in place.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Douglas S Rios in court with attorney Benjamin James Harris.  Defendant Douglas S Rios in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant declines the offer of the State.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 9-2-2015 at 8:15 am  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Rocio M., no firearms and no violations of the law.   All parties are notified as of 8-3-2015, this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38, in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  mld

Attorney Benjamin James Harris in court, defendant Douglas S Rios not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is currently on a VOP hold.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-28-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.  mld

Defendant Douglas S Rios in court with attorney Benjamin James Harris.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-7-2015 at 8:30 am.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld
$150.00 bail to be returned. Oral No Weapons Order  Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-24-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Douglas S Rios
Current: 5534 South 14th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53221   (Effective: 03-13-2015)
Prior: 5534 South 14th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53221
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Rocio M.B. or the residence or place of employment

Defendant Douglas S Rios in court with attorney Benjamin James Harris.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 04.vb
